alert.note: Alert for Kimble; Sutton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 25 at 1:59PM CDT until October 25 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WESTERN KIMBLE AND EASTERN SUTTON COUNTIES... At 158 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain from justs west of Telegraph north to Cleo...moving northeast at 30 mph. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Roosevelt, Telegraph, South Llano River State Park, I-10 Near The Sutton-kKmble County Line, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 2596 And Ranch Road 864, Cleo and Us-377 Near The Kimble-Edwards County Line. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
